From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: kupfer

German

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Middle High German kupfer, from Old High German kupfar, from Proto-West Germanic *kopr (“copper”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈkʊp͡fɐ/
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Audio (Austria):(file)

Noun

[edit]

Kupfer n (strong, genitive Kupfers, no plural)

  1. copper (chemical element, Cu, atomical number 29)

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Kupfer [sg-only, neuter, strong]
singular
indef. def. noun
nominative ein das Kupfer
genitive eines des Kupfers
dative einem dem Kupfer
accusative ein das Kupfer

Coordinate terms

[edit]
  • (chemical element): Previous: Nickel. Next: Zink

Derived terms

[edit]
  • kupfern
  • abkupfern
